#Text=Break-in attempted at mortuary housing remains of Kim Jong Nam
#Text=Thursday , February 23 , 2017
#Text=Malaysian police yesterday reported an attempted break-in at the morgue where the body of Kim Jong Nam was being held .
#Text=Kim , the half-brother of North Korean leader Kim Jong Un , was killed on February 13 in Kuala Lumpur International Airport in what authorities are treating as a murder case .
#Text=The police have increased security at the morgue .
#Text=We know who [ the perpetrators ] are .
#Text=No need to tell you .
#Text=— Police Chief Khalid Abu Bakar , of a break-in at the mortuary holding the remains of Kim Jong Nam .
#Text=" We knew there were attempts by someone to break into the hospital mortuary .

#Text=Yesterday , Chief Khalid said two other people , an Air Koryo employee named Kim Uk Il and a North Korean embassy employee named Hyon Kwang Song have  been called in for assistance .

_	_	_	_

#Text=Ibrahim cautioned listeners against assuming Kim Jong Nam 's death was necessarily ordered by his half-brother 's government :  the four hold North Korean nationality , that is all .

_	_	_	_

#Text=Four suspects have already been detained : Ri Jong Chol , a North Korean ; Siti Aishah , an Indonesian ; Muhammad Farid Bin Jalaluddin , a Malaysian ; and Doan Thi Huong , who was carrying a Vietnamese passport .

#Text=Kim fell ill and died before he could reach a hospital . One was wearing an  LOL " t-shirt at the time .

column1: #Text=Aishah told police she thought she had been hired to play a prank for a television show , but Chief Khalid disputed this , saying the two had been trained for their mission and told to wash their hands after handling the liquid .
#Text=Kim Jong Nam had once been his father Kim Jong Il 's heir apparent but fell out of favor and has been living in Macau with his family .
#Text=The Indonesian consulate requested access to Aishah but was refused .
#Text=According to Malaysian law , no one may speak to the suspects while the investigation is ongoing .
#Text=The North Korean government has called for the release of Ri Jong Chol and issued a statement saying the two women are also " innocent " and should be released as well .
#Text=The North Korean ambassador to Malaysia has questioned both the identity of the dead man and the reliability of the Malaysian investigation .
#Text=Malaysia recalled its ambassador from North Korean on Monday amid increasing tensions between the two countries .
#Text=Inspector-General Khalid continued to refer to the deceased as " Kim Chol , " one of two names on passports he had with him .
#Text=Malaysian authorities have refused to release Kim 's body to North Korea without a DNA sample from a family member .
#Text=Khalid has promised police protection for any relative coming to Malaysia to do so .
#Text=This story has updates See Siti Aisyah and Doan Thi Huong to be charged with murder of Kim Jong Nam with VX nerve agent , February 28 , 2017
